title: Security Vulnerabilities Due to Outdated Dependencies
body:
Hi,
I ran into several security vulnerabilities related to outdated dependencies.
```
flat  <5.0.1
Severity: critical
...
minimatch  <3.0.5
Severity: high
...
request  *
Severity: moderate
...
semver  <7.5.2
Severity: moderate
...
word-wrap  *
Severity: moderate
...
22 vulnerabilities (15 moderate, 4 high, 3 critical)
```

I believe most of them stem from eth-gas-reporter@0.2.25 and hardhat@2.16.1 using outdated mocha and glob packages:
```
$ npm list minimatch request semver  word-wrap flat
---@ /home/----/dev/----
├─┬ @nomicfoundation/hardhat-toolbox@3.0.0
│ ├─┬ @nomicfoundation/hardhat-verify@1.0.3
│ │ └── semver@6.3.0
│ ├─┬ hardhat-gas-reporter@1.0.9
│ │ └─┬ eth-gas-reporter@0.2.25
│ │   ├─┬ request-promise-native@1.0.9
│ │   │ ├─┬ request-promise-core@1.1.4
│ │   │ │ └── request@2.88.2 deduped
│ │   │ └── request@2.88.2 deduped
│ │   └── request@2.88.2
│ ├─┬ hardhat@2.16.1
│ │ ├─┬ glob@7.2.0
│ │ │ └── minimatch@3.1.2 deduped
│ │ ├─┬ mocha@10.2.0
│ │ │ ├── minimatch@5.0.1
│ │ │ └─┬ yargs-unparser@2.0.0
│ │ │   └── flat@5.0.2
│ │ ├── semver@6.3.0 deduped
│ │ └─┬ solc@0.7.3
│ │   └── semver@5.7.1
│ └─┬ typechain@8.2.0
│   └─┬ glob@7.1.7
│     └── minimatch@3.1.2 deduped
└─┬ solidity-coverage@0.8.3
  ├─┬ mocha@7.1.2
  │ ├─┬ glob@7.1.3
  │ │ └── minimatch@3.0.4 deduped
  │ ├── minimatch@3.0.4
  │ ├─┬ node-environment-flags@1.0.6
  │ │ └── semver@5.7.1
  │ └─┬ yargs-unparser@1.6.0
  │   └── flat@4.1.1
  ├─┬ recursive-readdir@2.2.3
  │ └── minimatch@3.1.2
  ├─┬ sc-istanbul@0.4.6
  │ ├─┬ escodegen@1.8.1
  │ │ └─┬ optionator@0.8.3
  │ │   └── word-wrap@1.2.3
  │ └─┬ glob@5.0.15
  │   └── minimatch@3.1.2 deduped
  └── semver@7.5.3
```
Is there any way to force newer version on your end?
